task.title: Reusable Steps
task.shortdesc: You can conref these steps. Don't change anything in this file without checking where it is used.

cmd.draft-comment: The steps below are for data preview. They are used in "Previewing a Single Stage" and "Previewing Multiple Stages."

step.cmd: From the pipeline canvas, click Preview.
step.info: If the Preview button is disabled, check the Issues list for unconnected stages and required properties that are not defined.
step.stepresult:
The Preview panel highlights the origin stage and displays preview records in the Output Data column. Since this is the origin of the pipeline, no input data displays.
You can drill down to view the details of a record.

step.cmd: To delete a record that you do not want to use, click the Delete icon.
To change field values, in the Input Data column, click the value that you want to change and enter a new value.
step.info: You can edit values for any input data.

step.cmd: To process changed data, click the Re-Run Preview With Changes icon.
step.stepresult: In the Input Data column, records with changed values display with an asterisk and the changed values are highlighted. The Output Data column displays the results of processing. You can change and process preview data as often as necessary.

step.cmd: To revert all changes and return to the beginning of the data preview, click the Revert Changes icon.
To preview the next set of data, click Refresh Preview.
To exit data preview and return to pipeline configuration, click Close Preview.

cmd.draft-comment: The following step is used in "Previewing a Single Stage" and "Reviewing Snapshot Data"

step.cmd: To view data for the next stage, click Next Stage. Or, to view data for a different stage, select the stage in the pipeline canvas.

cmd.draft-comment: The following step is used at the beginning of "Starting a Pipeline" "Resetting the Origin" and "Stopping a Pipeline".

step.cmd: Verify that the pipeline that you want to stop appears in the pipeline canvas.
step.info: If it does not, select the pipeline that you want to stop from the Pipeline library.

cmd.draft-comment: The first step should used for origins. Use the first & 2nd steps for processors.

step.cmd: In the Properties panel, optionally enter a name and description for the stage.
For Required Fields, enter any fields that you want to require data.
step.info: You might include any field that the processor uses.

cmd.draft-comment: Use these two steps for destination tasks.

step.cmd: In the Properties panel, optionally enter a name and description for the stage.
For Required Fields, enter any fields that you want to require data.
